content.summary: A cloud-native, real-time restaurant management platform integrating Point of Sale (POS), Kitchen Display Systems (KDS), and inventory analytics to streamline front and back-of-house operations.
content.description: This platform addresses the chaotic nature of restaurant operations by synchronizing data instantly between servers, the kitchen, and management. Targeted at mid-sized full-service restaurants, it replaces legacy paper-ticket systems with digital workflows. The core value proposition is increasing table turnover rates, reducing food waste through precise ordering, and providing owners with actionable real-time sales data.

user_stories.title: Digital Order Entry
user_stories.story: As a Server, I want to input customer orders on a handheld device so that the kitchen receives them instantly without manual tickets.
user_stories.description: Develop a responsive POS interface for tablets allowing item selection, modifier customization (e.g., no onions), and order submission to the backend.
acceptance_criteria: Server can select items from categorized menu
Modifiers can be added to specific items
Order submission triggers real-time update to backend
UI provides visual confirmation of successful submission
Offline mode stores order locally until reconnected
user_stories.user_value: Reduces order errors and speeds up service time by 30%

user_stories.title: Kitchen Display System (KDS)
user_stories.story: As a Line Cook, I want to see incoming orders sorted by time and station so that I can prepare food in the correct sequence.
user_stories.description: Create a real-time dashboard for kitchen screens that displays active orders, highlights long-wait items, and allows bumping orders when complete.
acceptance_criteria: Orders appear on KDS within 2 seconds of submission
Items are routed to specific stations (Grill vs Salad)
Color coding changes based on wait time thresholds
Cook can mark individual items or whole tickets as done
Recall function exists for accidentally closed tickets
user_stories.user_value: Eliminates lost paper tickets and optimizes kitchen throughput

user_stories.title: Dynamic Table Management
user_stories.story: As a Host, I want to see a visual map of table occupancy status so that I can seat walk-in guests efficiently.
user_stories.description: Implement a drag-and-drop floor plan editor and a live view showing table status (Open, Seated, Billed, Dirty).
acceptance_criteria: Map reflects real-time status changes from POS
Host can manually update table status
Hovering over a table shows current server and seating time
Layout supports multiple rooms/zones
Conflict alert if assigning a seated table
user_stories.user_value: Maximizes seating capacity and reduces customer wait times

user_stories.title: Menu Configuration
user_stories.story: As a Manager, I want to edit menu items, modifiers, and prices in real-time so that servers always have up-to-date information.
user_stories.description: Build an admin panel for CRUD operations on menu categories, items, and pricing, including 86ing (out of stock) items.
acceptance_criteria: Manager can add/edit/delete menu items
Price changes reflect immediately on POS terminals
Items can be marked as 'Out of Stock' globally
Supports time-based menus (Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner)
Audit log tracks who made changes and when
user_stories.user_value: Ensures pricing accuracy and inventory availability

user_stories.title: Bill Splitting
user_stories.story: As a Server, I want to split a check by seat or specific items so that customers can pay separately.
user_stories.description: Implement logic to divide a single order object into multiple sub-orders or payment transactions without data loss.
acceptance_criteria: Split by equal amounts (e.g., 1/3 each)
Split by specific items assigned to seats
Combined payment methods allowed (Cash + Card)
Original total matches sum of splits exactly
Receipts print individually for each split
user_stories.user_value: Improves customer satisfaction during payment process

acceptance_criteria.criteria: System must handle 500 concurrent connections without latency exceeding 200ms.
acceptance_criteria.title: High Load Performance

acceptance_criteria.criteria: All payment data must be encrypted and PCI-DSS compliant.
acceptance_criteria.title: Security Compliance

acceptance_criteria.criteria: UI must be fully functional on 10-inch tablets in landscape mode.
acceptance_criteria.title: Tablet Responsiveness

acceptance_criteria.criteria: System should support dark mode for low-light restaurant environments.
acceptance_criteria.title: Dark Mode Support

assumptions: Venue has reliable high-speed internet connection.
Staff will use provided tablets (iPad or Android) for POS.
Payment processing is handled via third-party API (Stripe/Square).
Kitchen hardware supports HTML5 browser rendering.

strengths: Lower cost than legacy hardware systems
weaknesses: Brand new market entrant vs established players
threats: Aggressive pricing from Toast and Square

stakeholders.interest: ROI, theft prevention, and sales reporting
Ease of use, speed of order entry, tip tracking
Order clarity, timing accuracy, kitchen flow

invest_analysis.comments: Can be built in parallel with POS.
